div.p: FOIA.gov is a government-wide portal for the Freedom of Information Act
that was developed as part of the Department of Justice's Open Government plan.
At FOIA.gov, the public has access to all the FOIA data
collected by the Department of Justice on behalf of the federal government.
You can view, sort, and search through the FOIA data.
You can generate new or comparative reports.
You can learn about how the FOIA works and how to make FOIA requests to federal agencies.
Finally, you can explore significant FOIA releases that have been made as a result of past requests.
